column4: it would be good if there was an omit broken crap button on the update notifier
anyone fancy helping me get alsa back as an option in my sound devices after it decided to disappear
I need the output from that command.
is there no roll back driver option
they should have put that in before they decided to release this
00:14.2 Audio device: ATI Technologies Inc SB450 HDA Audio (rev 01)

these things tend to happen to often for my liking, I was going to recommend for my work place but I think not... Is there any way once I get these things working AGAIN that I can lock them so that nothing can touch them again
I can't help you if you don't at least give me the URL that that script generates.
oh, how do I run the script its saved on my desktop
open a Terminal, then type:  bash ~/Desktop/alsa-info.sh
/ Acidictadpole: I'm in a conference call for the next 30 minutes; I'll check back.
